snippet: The study by the Journalism Project at the Pew Research Center, which surveyed all 50 capitals, found a loss in newspaper reporters, but a gain in nontraditional ones.
abstract: Study by Pew Research Center finds that country's state capitals have lost more than one-third of newspaper journalists devoted to covering legislative matters full time; also shows that nontraditional news organizations have added journalists at statehouses.
lead_paragraph: The study by the Journalism Project at the Pew Research Center, which surveyed all 50 capitals, found a loss in newspaper reporters, but a gain in nontraditional ones.

headline.seo: Pew Research Center Says 164 Statehouse Reporters Have Been Cut Since 2003
headline.main: Pew Study Finds a Sharp Drop in Reporters at Statehouses
headline.print_headline: Pew Study Finds a Sharp Drop in Reporters at Statehouses
